conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a square wire frame in a magnetic field.
Square wire frame with side length 0.2 meters, half in a magnetic field directed into the paper.
Magnetic field increases at 10 T/s; need to find potential difference between points a and b.
Left half of the square is in the magnetic field, right half is not.
Change in magnetic flux induces an EMF according to Faraday's law.
Calculate total area of the square: 0.04 m².
Effective area in magnetic field is 0.02 m².
Magnetic flux change rate is 0.2 Wb/s.
Induced current flows clockwise to oppose increasing magnetic field.
Points a and b are connected by a segment not in the magnetic field.
Trace current flow: down right side, left bottom side, up left side, right top side.
